title: England's Billy Vunipola 'very likely' to be fit to face Australia in World Cup quarter-final
text:
England rate the chances of Billy Vunipola being fit to face Australia as “very likely” for the World Cup quarter-final at the Oita Stadium, handing a major boost to head coach Eddie Jones.

Vunipola took part in training on Tuesday at the team’s new training base in Beppu and is said to be on course to recover from the ankle injury that he sustained in the victory over Argentina which forced him out of the action at half-time. Vunipola, the only player to have started all 12 of England’s Tests this year, is certain to start if fit.

“Billy is progressing really well,” defence coach John...
description: England rate the chances of Billy Vunipola being fit to face Australia as “very likely” for the World Cup quarter-final at the Oita Stadium, handing a major boost to head coach Eddie Jones.
